Prompt:
Example 1:
Cat and Dog walk. They walk in their village. Then they see an egg. The egg is in the grass. The egg is alone in the grass. The egg is all alone. Cat and Dog walk to a bird. They ask the bird, "Is this your egg?" But the bird says, "No, that is not my egg. Ask the owl. Maybe it is his egg." Cat and Dog walk to the owl. They ask the owl, "Is this your egg?" But the owl says, "No, that is not my egg. Ask the goose. Maybe it is her egg." Cat and Dog walk to the goose. They ask the goose, "Is this your egg?" But the goose says, "No, that is not my egg. Ask the two ducks. Maybe it is their egg." Cat and Dog walk to the two ducks. They ask the two ducks, "Is this your egg?" But the two ducks say, "No, that is not our egg." Then the egg breaks.

Example 2:
The Sun’s light shines on Earth. The light makes our air, land, and water warm. But some things get
warmer than others.
Pretend it is a sunny day. If you wore a black shirt, you would feel hot. But if you wore a white shirt, you wouldn’t feel as hot. The dark color absorbs more of the Sun’s energy. That makes the black shirt warm.
Light colors reflect more of the Sun’s energy. This makes the white shirt cooler to wear. See for yourself! You need a piece of black paper and a piece of white paper. You also need two thermometers and a lamp. Ask an adult to help you.
Fold the black paper so it makes a pocket. Do the same thing to the white paper. Next, put a thermometer into the black pocket. Do the same thing to the white pocket. Then put the pockets under the lamp. Turn the lamp on, and wait for 10 minutes. Then check the thermometers.
Which pocket got hotter — the black pocket or the white one? Do you know why?

Using vocabulary and structure from examples, write a short paragraph about 'astronomy' targeting the same readability level (Early Elementary), limited to 200 words. 
In the night sky, there are stars and planets. We can see them with our eyes. But we can’t see them very well. That is because we are on Earth, and they are very far away. To see them better, we need to use a telescope. A telescope helps us see the stars and planets more clearly. We can see the moon with a telescope too. It looks big and round. We can also see the sun with a telescope, but we have to be very careful. The sun is very hot and can hurt our eyes. So, we need to wear special glasses to look at it safely. Astronomers use telescopes to learn more about the stars and planets. They want to know where they came from and what they are made of. They also want to know if there are other planets like Earth. By using telescopes, astronomers can answer these questions and learn more about the universe.

Astronomy is the study of the stars and the world. People do astronomy to learn about the world. We live on a big ball called Earth. Earth is in space. Space is full of stars. The stars shine at night. Sometimes we see a shooting star. That is a rock that is burning. The rock is burning because it is close to the Sun. The Sun is a big ball of fire. It makes our world warm. We have a moon that goes around the Earth. The moon has no fire. It is a cold rock. We can see the moon in the sky at night. We can see the stars in the sky too. People use special machines to see the stars and the world. They are called telescopes. Telescopes help us learn about the world. We can use telescopes to see the moon and the stars. We can even see other worlds. Other worlds are like our world. They are in space too. Astronomy is fun and cool

Astronomy is the study of the universe. People who study astronomy look up at the stars and the Moon. They ask questions like, "How far away are the stars?" or "How many stars are there?" They use big machines to look at the stars and the Moon. These machines can see things that are too far away to see with our eyes. One of these machines is called a telescope. Astronomers also use computers to help them. They can use the computers to show pictures of the stars and the Moon. Some astronomers go to space to study the stars and the Moon. They go up in a rocket and stay up there for a while. When they come back, they tell us what they saw. Then we can learn about the universe and how big it is.

Astronomy is the study of stars, planets, and galaxies. It helps us understand the universe and how things move in space. Some things in space are very big. The Sun is a star. It shines light on Earth. The Earth is a planet. It goes around the Sun. The Moon is another object in space. It goes around the Earth. Some things in space are very small. Comets are tiny objects that shine in the sky. They are made of ice and rock. They melt when they get close to the Sun. A telescope is a tool used to study objects in space. It helps us see things that are far away. Astronomers are people who study the universe. They use telescopes to learn about stars, planets, and galaxies. They want to know how the universe began and how it will end. They also want to know if there are other life forms in space. Astronomers are curious people who want to learn more about the universe.

Astronomy is a study about the sky. We can see many things in the sky. But what is the sky? The sky is made of air. The air is made up of many small things called molecules. These molecules move around. They move around because of the Sun’s heat. The Sun’s heat makes the air warm. The warm air rises. That’s why we can see the sky. We see the sky because the warm air moves away from the Sun. The air moves away from the Sun because the Sun’s heat makes it rise. There are many things in the sky. We can see stars, planets, and the Moon. We can even see comets. These are things that are made of ice. When they get close to the Sun, they melt. They melt because the Sun’s heat makes them warm. The warm ice melts into the Sun’s heat. The melted ice turns into gas. This gas makes a beautiful tail that we can see in the sky
